pigpen

Class Pen

  • java.lang.Object
    • pigpen.Pen

  • public class Pen
extends java.lang.Object
    A Pen composed of four fences. Every Pen shares some or all fences with other Pens.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Square Mode Bottom Fence

      Hexagon Mode East Fence

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean closed()
      Checks if the all the Pen's fences have been filled in.
      int[] fences()
      Returns a four element array in the form [TOP,RIGHT,BOTTOM,LEFT] (Square Mode) or [NE,E,SE,SW,W,NW] (Hexagon Mode) containing the ID's of the players who have filled in the fences.
      int id()
      Returns the ID of the Pen.
      Pen n(int fence)
      Gets the Pen neighboring the given fence
      int[] pick(int fence)
      Generates a return value for Player.pick()
      int remaining()
      Returns the number of empty fences on this Pen.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      int winner()
      Returns the winner of the Pen, or zero if it is still open.

    • Method Detail

      • pick

        public int[] pick(int fence)
        Generates a return value for Player.pick()
        Parameters:
        fence - the ID of the fence: TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, or LEFT (Square Mode) or NE, E, SE, SW, W, NW (Hexagon Mode)
        Returns:
        a two element array in the form [PenID, FenceID]

      • closed

        public boolean closed()
        Checks if the all the Pen's fences have been filled in.

      • n

        public Pen n(int fence)
        Gets the Pen neighboring the given fence
        Returns:
        a neighboring Pen, or Pen with ID -1 if there is no neighbor sharing the given fence

      • fences

        public int[] fences()
        Returns a four element array in the form [TOP,RIGHT,BOTTOM,LEFT] (Square Mode) or [NE,E,SE,SW,W,NW] (Hexagon Mode) containing the ID's of the players who have filled in the fences. If no player has filled in a fence, it's value will be 0.

      • id

        public int id()
        Returns the ID of the Pen. The top left Pen has ID 1.

      • winner

        public int winner()
        Returns the winner of the Pen, or zero if it is still open.

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Returns the number of empty fences on this Pen.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
